story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in Indonesia, there was a kind and curious little boy named Sari. Sari loved to explore the jungle near his home and learn about all the different animals that lived there.

One day, as Sari was walking through the jungle, he heard a strange noise. It sounded like a soft, musical humming coming from a nearby tree. Sari followed the sound and discovered a beautiful bird with feathers of all different colors, sitting on a branch and singing.

Sari had never seen a bird like this before. He asked the bird, "Who are you, and where do you come from?"

The bird replied, "I am the Rainbow Bird, and I come from a magical land far, far away. I am on a journey to spread joy and beauty to all the corners of the world."

Sari was fascinated by the Rainbow Bird and asked if he could join her on her journey. The Rainbow Bird agreed, and together they set off on a great adventure.

They traveled to many different places, meeting all sorts of new animals and seeing amazing sights. The Rainbow Bird sang her beautiful song wherever she went, and people couldn't help but smile and dance along.

One day, as they were flying over a dense forest, they were suddenly surrounded by a group of monkeys. The monkeys were curious about the Rainbow Bird and wanted to know where she came from.

Sari was afraid, but the Rainbow Bird was not afraid. She sang her beautiful song, and the monkeys were so entranced that they forgot all about their bad intentions. Instead, they joined in the singing and dancing, and a great celebration was had by all.

After many weeks of traveling, the Rainbow Bird and Sari finally reached the end of their journey. They had spread joy and beauty to every corner of the world, and the people were grateful.

The Rainbow Bird thanked Sari for his help and gave him a special gift - a feather that would always remind him of the wonderful adventure they had shared.

Sari returned home to his village, where he was hailed as a hero. He told the villagers all about his journey with the Rainbow Bird, and they were amazed.

From that day on, Sari never forgot the lessons he had learned on his adventure - to be kind, to be curious, and to always spread joy and beauty wherever he went.

And every night, before he went to bed, Sari would look at the Rainbow Bird feather and remember his great adventure, feeling grateful for the magical friend he had made.

The end.

Good night, my dear son, I hope you enjoyed the story! May you always have sweet dreams and a vivid imagination.
